2.1.8. Lab – Implement Dynamic Certificate Injection¶

In this section we will use HTTP Connector to retrieve a user’s certificate from Active Directory to be used in the BIG-IP Certificate minting process

2.1.8.1. Task – Create a HTTP Connector Transport¶

  1. Navigate to Access >> Authentication >> HTTP Connector >> HTTP Connector Transport Click the + plus Symbol

  1. Enter Name demo-http-connector
  2. Select prebuilt-dns-resolver from the DNS Resolver dropdown
  3. Select prebuilt-adpiadmin-serverssl from the Server SSL Profile
  4. Click Save

2.1.8.2. Task – Create a HTTP Connector Request¶

  1. Navigate to Access >> Authentication >> HTTP Connector >> HTTP Connector Request. Click the + plus symbol

  1. Enter name get-cert
  2. Select demo-http-connector from the dropdown
  3. Enter URL https://adapi.f5lab.local:8443/aduser/cert?useridentity=%{perflow.username}
  4. Enter GET for the Method
  5. Select Parse for the Response Action
  6. Click Save

2.1.8.3. Task – Create a Per-Request Policy¶

  1. Navigate to Access >> Profiles/Policies >> Per-Request Policies Click the + Plus Symbol

  1. Enter the name certsso_prp
  2. Select the Language English
  3. Click Finished

  1. Click edit under Per-Request Policy

  1. Click Add New Subroutine

  1. Enter the name Request Cert
  2. Click Save

  1. Expand the subroutine by click the + plus symbol

  1. Click the + plus symbol on the fallback branch.

  1. Click the General Purpose tab
  2. Select HTTP Connector
  3. Click Add Item

  1. Select get-cert drop the dropdown

  1. Click Edit Terminals

  1. Click Add Terminal

  1. Change the name for the default branch to Fail
  2. Change the default branch text to Red
  3. Enter the name Success for the new branch
  4. Change the color of the new branch to Success

  1. Click the Fail terminal at the end of the Successful branch

  1. Select the Success Terminal
  2. Click Save

  1. Click the + plus symbol on the successful branch

  1. Click the Assignment tab
  2. Select Variable Assign
  3. Click Add Item

  1. Click Add new entry
  2. Click change

  1. Enter session.ssl.cert.whole for the Custom Variable
  2. Select Session Variable from the dropdown
  3. Enter subsession.http_connector.body.certificate for the Session Variable
  4. Click Finished

  1. Click Save

  1. Click the + plus symbol located between Start and Allow in the policy

  1. Click the Subroutines tab
  2. Select the Request Cert subroutine
  3. Click Add Item

  1. Click the + plus symbol on the success branch of Request Cert

  1. Click the General Purpose tab
  2. Select irule Event
  3. Click Add Item

Note

This irule event triggers the code from the previously attached irule. This irule must be used when inserting a certificate using C3D in a per-request policy.

when ACCESS_PER_REQUEST_AGENT_EVENT {
set cert [ACCESS::session data get {session.ssl.cert.whole}]
log local0. “My cert: $cert”
SSL::c3d cert [X509::pem2der $cert]
}

  1. Enter lab for the ID
  2. Click Save

2.1.8.4. Task – Attach the PRP to the mTLS virtual Server¶

  1. Navigate to Local Traffic >> Virtual Servers. Click Virtual Server List

  1. Click mtls_vs

  1. Navigate to the Access Policy Section and select certsso_prp from the Per-Request Policy dropdown
  2. Click Update
